docs.text: i have nothing against unabashedly romantic films .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when done right , with at least slightly evident restraint , they can be engaging , sweeping , appealing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but it's a hell of a shame when someone botches it as badly as nora ephron botched sleepless in seattle , a hollow , boring romance that should appeal only to the most gullible of viewers ; the ones willing to buy into ephron's whiny views of life and romance .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: tom hanks and meg ryan , two of hollywood's most likeable stars play sam baldwin and annie reed , repectively .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: baldwin's wife recently died and he moved to seattle with his son , jonah , seeking to get away from the familiar surroundings which remind him of his late spouse .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jonah senses tension and calls a talk radio show to tell the world about their problems .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sam seems ready to strangle his son for calling the show , but when he gets on the phone he begins pouring his heart out .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ephron has him do this so that annie reed ( meg ryan ) can hear it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: annie is a happy woman .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she is engaged to walter , an allergy-prone working man and seems to be perfectly content .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but after hearing sam the widower on the radio show , she becomes convinced that he is her destiny and is willing to risk her engagement for it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: five years after this movie hit theaters , hanks , ryan and ephron would team up again in the far better , although still sub-par romantic comedy you've got mail , which is about people who hate each other in real life falling in love on the internet .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at least that movie had a sense of spontaneity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here it seems that the first one hundred minutes exist solely to set up for the last five .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the fact that sam and annie will finally meet is so excruciatingly obvious that everything else is perfunctory .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sleepless in seattle is full of wonderful performers ; from its two leads to supporting stars like bill pullman and rosie o'donnell .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but none of them can save the film from being a bore .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: its characters are dull and empty , its script isn't funny or particularly charming .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the script has a fundamental problem : annie gives up , for little reason , her life with walter to pursue " sleepless in seattle , " whom she has never even seen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's the kind of life decision that real people don't make , and its a major , unforgivable plausibility sacrifice .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in essence , this movie's purpose is to head towards a goal that shouldn't even exist .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's a ten minute short film with ninety-five minutes of filler .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if you were to show me sleepless in seattle and i didn't have to review it , you could just call me " asleep in philadelphia . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ? 1999 eugene novikov&#137 ;
docs.label: negative
